_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Facility Policy

The management and employees of Farmers Feed & Grain Company are committed to the prevention of any
accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, our facility is prepared
to work with the Riceville Fire Department, the Howard County LEPC and any other authorities to mitigate
and minimize the impact of the release to the people of this community and the environment.

2. Facility Information

The primary activity of this facility is the sale of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous
ammonia, is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  
NH3 is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3. Worst-Case and Alternate Release Scenario

An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental
release have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4. Accidental Release Prevention Program

This facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 regulation.  "Storage and
handling of anhydrous ammonia" and our state regulations covering NH3.  The OSHA standard is referenced
in this RMP Registration Form. (Section 8.3 b.)

5. Five Year Accident History

We have had NO accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused 
any deaths, injuries, significant property damage, evacuations, or environmental damage at our facility.  
To the best of our knowledge, there have been NO off-site accidental releases resulting in death, injury, 
property damage, or envirnomental damage.

6. Emergency Action Plan

This facility has:

   A.  A written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

   B. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know 
       information as required under SARA Tier III (EPCRA);

   C. If  a large release of anhydrou

s ammonia takes place at this facility, the required response action is to 
       evacuate the area of the spill and call the Riceville Fire Dept., Howard County LEPC, and all applicable 
       emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Since safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility, periodic evaluations are performed to assess
the site conditions.  There are no specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous
ammonia for implementation at this time.
